Award.AwardTitle: Conference Support -- International Conference on Intelligent Systems Applications to Power Systems ISAP2017; September17-21, 2017; San, Antonio, Texas

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: This project provides funding to partially support travel expenses for U.S. students to allow them to participate in an international conference in power engineering, the 2017 edition of the International Conference on Intelligent Systems Applications to Power Systems (ISAP2017). The conference will take place in San Antonio, Texas during September 17-21, 2017. The conference is technically cosponsored by the Power Engineering Society of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE). ISAP conference papers will be available to subscribers of the IEEE-Explore data base on a permanent basis. The support provided by this award will provide an opportunity for students to share their research with one another and with faculty and industry experts. Measures will be taken to encourage participation in the conference of women and underrepresented minorities.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2017 Intelligent System Application to Power Systems (ISAP) Conference was organized and hosted by Texas A&M University from September 17-20, 2017 in San Antonio, TX. The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) Workshop on Utility Big Data was co-located with the 2017 ISAP on September 18, 2017. ISAP is the only international conference entirely dedicated to intelligent systems applications for power systems and thus provided an ideal forum for the presentation of innovative research fostering close interactions between researchers.

Twenty graduate students from twelve U.S. universities were supported with NSF funds to participate in the 2017 ISAP Conference. 111 registrants from the U.S. and 14 countries attended the conference. The joint 2017 ISAP Conference and IEEE Workshop on Utility Big Data highlighted opportunities and challenges in collecting, procesing, and providing value out of big data power system applications. On the remaining days of the 2017 ISAP Conferende, researchers and practitioners presented their work on theory and application of intelligent systems on topics such as power systems operation in a competitive environment, renewable energy and distributed generation. Plenary sessions focused on past, present, and future in intelligent systems applications to power, and software tools and AI applications. Conference papers are available in the IEEE Explore Digital Library.

Since the venue of the bi-annual conference traditionally rotates between Europe, North America, South America, and Asia, 2017 ISAP provided a unique and most likely the only opportunity for currently enrolled students in the U.S. to interact exclusively with international experts in the area of intelligent systems for power systems.
